metadata.Title: CVE-2020-4031 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
In FreeRDP before version 2.1.2, there is a use-after-free ingdi_SelectObject. All FreeRDP clients using compatibility mode with/relax-order-checks are affected. This is fixed in version 2.1.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-4031` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

freerdp2-shadow-x11 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
freerdp2-wayland - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
freerdp2-x11 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libfreerdp-client2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libfreerdp-server2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libfreerdp-shadow-subsystem2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libfreerdp-shadow2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libfreerdp2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libuwac0-0 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwinpr-tools2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwinpr2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
winpr-utils - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freerdp2 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
